author: Special Correspondent
text:
Governor K. Rosaiah and Chief Minister Jayalalithaa on Thursday condoled the death of Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister and People’s Democratic Party (PDP) leader Mufti Mohammad Sayeed.

In his condolence message, Mr. Rosaiah said the 79-year old leader was an able administrator, who served in various capacities in both the State and Central governments.

“As a man of perseverance, he continued to fight for peace and prosperity in the State of Jammu and Kashmir. His death is an irreparable loss to the people of Jammu and Kashmir. I convey my deepest condolences to the bereaved members of the family and pray to God to rest his soul in peace,” Mr. Rosaiah’s message released from the Raj Bhavan stated.

Ms. Jayalalithaa said she was shocked to hear the sad and untimely demise of the founder of the PDP. Mr. Sayeed was one of the tallest leaders from Jammu and Kashmir with long years of experience in politics and government both in the State and at the Centre, she said.

“He dedicated his life to bring peace and tranquillity to Jammu and Kashmir. In his passing away, the nation has lost a great leader and a politician of great distinction. I convey my heartfelt condolences to his daughter Mehbooba Mufti Sayeed and other members of the family,” Ms. Jayalalithaa’s message released from the Secretariat stated.

The National flag at the Secretariat was flown at half mast.

Mr. Sayeed passed away at the All India Institute of Medical Sciences in New Delhi, following multiple organ failure on Thursday after nearly a week-long hospitalisation. He was 79.
title: Governor, CM condole Mufti’s death
